summary: This paper proposes a formal, generic conceptual model of scholarly research activity that spans planning, execution, knowledge construction, and curation across the full research lifecycle. Grounded in activity theory and expressed using CIDOC CRM, it integrates activities, goals, methods, tools, and research objects, supported by explicit diagrams. The model addresses limitations of prior process-centric approaches and is intended to guide empirical analysis and the design of digital research infrastructures.
